page.title: 01MURTON/HILTON/BRACKENBER
page.content: This block covers a rural area on the western slopes of the Pennines in northern England, embracing two small villages of Murton and Hilton and the hamlet of Brackenber. The area is part of the Eden valley, some 15 miles outside the Lake District National Park. The Eden valley has its attractions for holidaymakers but tourism plays a lesser role in day-to-day life to that of farming, which is the economic support for many families. These fellside villages have their own patterns of life, but local people are involved in activities beyond their own boundaries, too.
